structural_analysis.context_justification: The primary structural division is the Khanda (section). The text starts with Prathama Khanda (1) and the first unit is Mantra 1. Thus, the coordinate is 1.1.
structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines grantha ID, commentary author slug (rangaramanuja), and zero-padded start ID (01-01) for unique, sortable naming.

proposed_strategy.name: Single Chunk Optimization
proposed_strategy.description: The entire text is extremely short (under 20,000 characters). It is most efficient to process the entire document as a single chunk, well below the minimum target size.

execution_plan.description: All prefatory material (Shanti Path, Preamble), Khandas 1 through 4, and concluding material (Colophon, Uttarashantipatha).

parsing_instructions.justification: The Khanda is the major structural section and provides clear, consistent boundaries for parsing the text segments.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: The Khanda number is expressed as a Sanskrit ordinal word (e.g., प्रथम, द्वितीय) preceding the word खण्डः in the bolded header.

start_pattern.description: A new Khanda begins with a bolded heading indicating its number.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Khanda is marked by the phrase 'X समाप्तः' where X is the Khanda name or number, optionally followed by commentary colophon.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: The initial text block containing the Samaveda Shanti Path, introductory shlokas, and the author's preamble should be treated as 'Prefatory Material' before the start of the First Khanda.
